intro: Sorghum friesii, commonly known as the African millet, is a flowering plant native to sub-Saharan Africa. It is a member of the Poaceae family, which includes grasses, and is characterized by its tall, cylindrical stalks and small, clustered spikelets. The plant is drought-tolerant and thrives in poor soil conditions, making it an important crop in arid regions. Its seeds are used for food, animal feed, and traditional beverages. Sorghum friesii also plays a role in ecological systems by providing habitat for various insects and birds.
